availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, town marshal and soldier. Shelbyville, Kentucky, native. Married to G. Anna Pulliam on December 21, 1865. Shelby County resident in 1850. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from July 26, 1861, to September 9, 1861. Served in the Shelby County State Guard as a private from September 5, 1862, to November 1, 1862. Town marshal in Shelbyville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, p. 302A.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 52.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 856.
Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Shelby County, December 21, 1865 (Accessed via Ancestry.com).
